thread.title: One of three men wanted in connection with a shoot
thread.title_full: One of three men wanted in connection with a shoot

title: One of three men wanted in connection with a shoot
text:
One of three men wanted in connection with a shooting on Sandy Bay First Nation one month ago has been arrested by Winnipeg police on unrelated charges.
Gregory James Lee Spence was arrested and charged Tuesday with 11 offences, including possession of a loaded prohibited or restricted gun and five other firearm offences, and possession of cocaine and methamphetamine for the purposes of trafficking.
A 38-year-old man and 18-year-old woman are facing similar charges, according to a Winnipeg police news release on Thursday. The woman was released while Spence and the 38-year-old were detained.
Spence, 36, had an outstanding warrant for his arrest from the Manitoba First Nations Police Service, the agency confirmed on Thursday.
Trio of men wanted by First Nations police after Sandy Bay shooting He was facing charges for breaking and entering, aggravated assault, pointing a firearm, uttering threats and more stemming from a shooting on Sandy Bay on Jan. 3.
Police were called to a home on the First Nation that day after reports that multiple people entered a home and assaulted someone. A male victim suffering from a gunshot wound was taken to hospital in stable condition.
Keith Douglas Racette, 28, and Jesse Myles St. Paul, 31, remain at large in connection with that incident, per an MFNPS news release on Thursday.
Racette and St. Paul are considered armed and dangerous and should not be approached, according to the MFNPS.
More from CBC Manitoba:
Winnipeg police warn of risks of driving while high amid campaign targeting drivers impaired by cannabis Winnipeg police charge 2nd man in kidnapping, sexual assault of teenage girl in September Manitoba NDP promises inflation-rate increase to school operating funding, says trustees can raise taxes
